text: Velvel Pasternak (October 1, 1933 â€“ June 11, 2019) was a Canadian-born American musicologist, conductor, arranger, producer and publisher. He was born in Toronto, Ontario to immigrant parents from Poland. Pasternak studied at Juilliard School and Columbia University, and specialized in Jewish music. In 1981, The New York Times Times called him "largest publisher of Jewish music." He was the founder of Tara Publications. He was responsible for publishing 26 recordings and over 150 books of Jewish music starting in 1971. Pasternak died in New York City on June 11, 2019, at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American composers Category:American conductors Category:American record producers Category:Jewish American musicians Category:Musicians from New York City Category:Musicians from Toronto Category:Musicologists
title: Velvel Pasternak
